info.title: Prototype GEAR API
info.description: Project to share GEAR's API usage.

get.description: This endpoint returns the complete list of GSA Business Applications, to include retired applications.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: The database key that identifies the Business Application. Example: '5576'

get.summary: Capabilities related to given Business Application List
get.description: This endpoint returns the Business Capabilites and Business Capability metadata associated to the indicated Business Application {id}.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: The database key that identifies the Business Application. Example: '5576'

get.summary: Technologies related to given Business Application List
get.description: This endpoint returns the IT Technologies and IT Technologies metadata associated to the indicated Business Application {id}.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: The database key that identifies the Business Application. Example: '5576'

200.description: An array of related Technologies of a given Business Application

get.summary: Business Application List related to given definition
get.description: This endpoint returns the list of GSA Business Applications related to given definition.

parameters.name: definition
parameters.description: The definition type that identifies the Business Application. Example: capabilities, itstandards, fisma, parentsystems, organizations, investments

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: The database key that identifies the Business Application. Example: '16999' for capabilities,'20872' for investments,

Id.description: The database key that identifies the Business Application.

SSO.description: Verbose name of the SSO that manages the application. USUALLY the parent SSO to Owner, but not always.

SSOShort.description: Short name of the SSO that manages the application. USUALLY the parent SSO to Owner, but not always.

Owner.description: Verbose name of the 2-letter office(s) that manages (co-manage) this application.

OwnerShort.description: Short name of the 2-letter office(s) that manages (co-manage) this application.

System.description: The Parent System name that includes this application. If not part of a System, then the value will be NULL.

BusinessPOC.description: List of business POCs, separated by commas

TechnicalPOC.description: List of technical POCs, separated by commas

Cloud.description: Is this Business Appliation hosted in the Cloud (as opposed to in a GSA Data Center)? Yes or No only.

TechnologyPlatform.description: Technology platform for the application. One of the following values: .Net, Appian, ArcGIS, Business Objects, ColdFusion, Django, Documentum, Drupal, Foxpro, Google App Engine (GAE), J2EE, Microsoft Office, Oracle, PowerBuilder, Provided as Package, Red Hat, Ruby on Rails, Salesforce, Unisys Mainframe, WordPress, Other.

Status.description: Status of the application. One of the following values: Pre-Production, Production, or Retired.

Alias.description: Other names by which this application is known.

RegionClassification.description: PBS-centric classification. Values will be National or Regional

HostingProvider.description: Service Provider for the application. One of the following values: Amazon, Appian, BSP, CGI, CTAC, ESRI, GSA, Google, HP Enterprise Services, IBM, Marathon Digital Services, Monster Govt Services, Noblis, OPM, Salesforce, SAP, ServiceNow, USDA Phase 1, USDA Phase 2, and Vanderweil (VFA).

FismaSystem.description: The FISMA System that provides an ATO for this application

Investment.description: The eCPIC Investment that provides funding for this application.

IsRevenueGenerator.description: Does this Business Application generate revenue? Values limited to Yes, No and TBD

DesktopComponent.description: Does this Business Application have a component that can be installed on a laptop or desktop? Values limited to Yes, No and TBD.

RetiredYear.description: Year the application was retired. Will be NULL if “Status” is not Retired

Capabilities.description: A comma separated list of the FEAF BRM capabilities that are supported by this application.

Technologies.description: A comma separated list of IT Standards that compose this application

Link.description: The URL that points to the applications web interface. If there are more than one, they will be separated by commas.

Id.description: The database key that identifies the Capabilities.

Ref.description: Position in the GSA hierarchy of FEAF Business Capability.

ParentCap.description: Name of the Parent Business Capability to this Business Capability.

Id.description: The database key that identifies the IT Standards.

Status.description: Position in the GSA hierarchy of FEAF Business Capability.

Expiration.description: Year and month that the approval for this standard expires. Standards that are not in an approved or pilot state will have NULL for this field.

Category.description: Standards category that this IT Standard fits into.
